normalised: **Film Festivals: More Than Just Red Carpets, Friend!**

unnormalised: **Film Festivals: More Than Just Red Carpets, Yaar!**
normalised: So, you've seen the pictures, right? Glamorous Bollywood stars, dazzling outfits, and maybe even a glimpse of Ranveer Singh's latest quirky ensemble. That's the public face of film festivals. But trust me, they're way more than just a fancy fashion show, especially for us desi film buffs!

unnormalised: So, you've seen the pictures, right? Glamorous Bollywood stars, dazzling outfits, and maybe even a glimpse of Ranveer Singh's latest quirky ensemble. That's the public face of film festivals. But trust me, they're way more than just a fancy fashion show, especially for us desi film buffs!
normalised: Think of film festivals as a giant thali of cinema. You've got your mainstream Bollywood's seasoning, sure, but you also get to sample indie films, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and international flicks you'd never find at your local P V R. It's a cinematic adventure!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant thali of cinema. You've got your mainstream Bollywood ka tadka, sure, but you also get to sample indie films, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and international flicks you'd never find at your local PVR. It's a cinematic adventure!
normalised: I remember attending the I F F I in Goa a few years back. Mind. Blown. I saw films from Iran, Argentina, even some super obscure ones from the Northeast. And the discussions after were amazing! Plus, you bump into aspiring directors and producers just hanging out, sipping chai and sharing their stories. Way more accessible than trying to land a meeting at Yash Raj Films, let me tell you.

normalised: The Kolkata International Film Festival is another big one. Heard they screened nearly three hundred films in two thousand and twenty three! Three hundred! That's more movies than I watch in a year! Plus, you can gorge on delicious Bengali food between screenings. Bonus points!

unnormalised: The Kolkata International Film Festival is another big one. Heard they screened nearly 300 films in 2023! 300! That's more movies than I watch in a year! Plus, you can gorge on delicious Bengali food between screenings. Bonus points!
normalised: But film festivals aren't just for the big cities. There are smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over India, focusing on everything from animation to L G B T Q plus cinema. Look for them! They often offer workshops and masterclasses too, so you can actually learn a thing or two.

unnormalised: But film festivals aren't just for the big cities. There are smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over India, focusing on everything from animation to LGBTQ+ cinema. Look for them! They often offer workshops and masterclasses too, so you can actually learn a thing or two.
normalised: So, next time you see a headline about a film festival, don't just think about the red carpet. Think about the stories waiting to be discovered, the filmmakers waiting to be heard, and the incredible opportunity to expand your cinematic horizons. It's an experience worth having, especially if you are keen to appreciate world cinema.
